title: Lionesses Roar: England Crowned European Champions After Thrilling Extra-Time Victory
content:
The wait is over! England has finally claimed its first-ever European Championship title, defeating Germany 2-1 in a thrilling extra-time battle at Wembley Stadium.  A record-breaking crowd of 87,192 witnessed history unfold, with Chloe Kelly, a comeback hero, scoring the winning goal in the 110th minute. 

This victory is more than just a trophy – it’s a symbol of progress and a testament to the incredible talent of the Lionesses.  England manager Sarina Wiegman, who remains unbeaten in 20 games, believes the world will change for her players, inspiring girls and women everywhere. 

The victory was hard-fought, with Ella Toone's sublime chip putting England ahead before Germany's Lina Magull equalized.  Despite losing captain Alexandra Popp to injury, Germany pushed England to the limit, showcasing the strength of women's football. 

The Lionesses' triumph is a moment to celebrate, a testament to the dedication and hard work of the players, and a beacon of hope for the future of women's football in England.
author: AFP
